content.description: Climb the face on positive, but friable flakes and edges to a mantle. Above the mantle continue on small edges and a flaring crack to a large flake/horn and the anchor.
content.location: Left side of the a South Face.

content.description: Begin climbing at the left margin of the north face and right of the gap between the rocks. Scramble onto a pointed pillar about eight feet above the base. From the top of the pillar climb the face on thin features and friction. Above the third bolt move onto the slopping black ramp on the right and continue on friction and small features to the anchor.

Half 'n' Half is a mixed route that climbs a crack until it pinches down, then moves right to hollow flakes protected by two bolts. If the 5.6 grade is too tame leaving the cams and nuts on the deck and utilizing just two quickdraws and an anchor definitely adds some spice to an ascent.
content.protection: Small cams (0.5 - 0.75) medium nut, two bolts.

content.description: The Groove climbs the overhung black streaked stem box on the right side of the north face of South Park. Climb the slightly right leaning groove on stellar flakes and edges. Judicious stemming and back stepping lead up the face past a couple of cruxy sequences and the anchors.

Better rock than most of the routes on the crag but not really good enough to sink hardware into... unless someone is really bored or has a box of bolts.

Probably in the 1.5 stars range for this crag.  You are here anyway, so you might as well tick it.
content.protection: Should be 5 bolts, but there are none in place.  You can toprope from the anchors to climbers right on Choss Avoidance Syndrome.  If you hurry, even the bolt locations are marked with chalk thumb prints.
content.location: Starts just left of Choss Avoidance Syndrome and trends left up the good rock in the black streak.  A steep and sharp top out will put you almost directly between the anchors of Shit Faced in Tuscaloosa and Choss Avoidance Syndrome.

content.description: A bouldery start in a flared seam leads to large holds. Continue up the grainy face on friction and rounded edges to a bulging black headwall. Move right and up on features to a good stance and the anchor.

As the name implies good route finding and astute choice of holds avoids choss and enhances route quality and the fun factor. Begin left of the large hueco on stellar holds on the orange patina plates. Clip the 1st bolt and continue up using the plates for hand and foot holds until a mantle leads to a stance atop the patina plates, being careful of the hollow exfoliated gong-like flake above. If you must use the hollow flake to complete the mantle gently pull down and not out. There's not much holding that "flake" in place. Move left onto the face and climb up on good edges and crimps on a broad black pillar to the anchor. Poor route finding or choice of holds could lead to a choss master's paradise.
content.location: Left of the center of the north face of South Park.
